| Name                                                                                         | amulet of reflection                                          |
| Appearance                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |

An **amulet of reflection** is a type of [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 NetHack brass](#NetHack_brass)
  - [6.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.5 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [6.6 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.7 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

7.5% of randomly generated amulets will be an amulet of reflection. The amulet will generate as uncursed 9⁄10 of the time, blessed 1⁄20 of the time, and cursed 1⁄20 of the time.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") prize on the final floor of the branch has a 1⁄2 chance of being a normally-generated amulet of reflection.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

For a character that enters the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") and is not generating [conflict](/wiki/Conflict "Conflict"), the [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") [guardian](/wiki/Minion "Minion") [Angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel") that is created next to them has a 3⁄4 chance of generating with an amulet of reflection.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Sokoban floor 4a has a 1⁄4 chance of an amulet of reflection, and 4b has a 3⁄4 chance.

## Description

When worn, the amulet conveys extrinsic [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), which causes [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") to [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound") in the opposite direction without damaging the wearer, and reflects passive [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze") attacks upon the gazing monster. The amulet will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") if it is seen reflecting a ray or gaze attack and the wearer does not have another source of reflection active.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Monsters will wear this amulet, and it is the only other amulet they will actively use besides an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") an amulet of reflection will have no effect.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Monsters may now wear the [amulet of guarding](/wiki/Amulet_of_guarding "Amulet of guarding") as well, making this amulet slightly more difficult to identify.

## Strategy

The amulet of reflection is a valuable item for any player, and is a powerful defense against [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand")-wielding monsters and [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") attacks. As such, it naturally factors into several [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") - compared to other sources, it does not severely penalize [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") like a shield of reflection, but is not as high-priority a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") as [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail"). The amulet of reflection is sometimes replaced upon procuring another source of reflection in order to open the amulet slot for life saving or [magical breathing](/wiki/Amulet_of_magical_breathing "Amulet of magical breathing").

Players keeping the amulet of reflection usually combine it with [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail") and any magical cloak that is not a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") - some may choose to wear a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection") for [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")3, and some casters using this combination may supplement their spellcasting with a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe"), optionally wearing a [ring of protection](/wiki/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") for MC3. The amulet is also a primary source of reflection for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") avoiding body armor and shields, as well as [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct") players: [vegetarians](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") and vegans covering resistances, [nudist](/wiki/Nudist "Nudist") and/or [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") players, and so on. Sokoban's potential for an amulet of reflection makes it an enticing early-game destination once a player has established an adequate starting kit, especially if they fit any of the above play styles.

Informally identifying an amulet of reflection is somewhat tricky - in practice, confirmation usually comes in the form of a typically-undesirable ray hitting you. A [wand of magic missile](/wiki/Wand_of_magic_missile "Wand of magic missile") is the least harmful wand to have used against you; you may also prefer to zap it at a wall and see if it hits you on the rebound. One risky potential means of testing for an amulet of reflection is using a [floating eye](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye"), where you are positioned in a manner that no other monsters can get to you if you are paralyzed - if you attack the eye in melee and its passive gaze is reflected by the amulet, it will auto-identify.

Beware of monsters possibly wearing the amulet, especially around the Sokoban [zoo](/wiki/Zoo "Zoo") - this is ideally prevented by the scroll of scare monster placed underneath it, but it is still possible for a monster to end up on the square in a few circumstances. A closet with the scroll but no prize means one of the monsters has grabbed the amulet, and you should ideally avoid reflectable wands and spells if possible until you track it down.

## History

The amulet of reflection first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

From [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including some variants based on those versions, [ki-rin](/wiki/Ki-rin "Ki-rin") are capable of wearing amulets. This makes the ki-rin an incredibly popular [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed") in those versions and variants, with the amulet of reflection being a common choice for them. This is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") via [commit 1a428307](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/1a428307f324dd47af7cd3d11e4f086e8646bbe6).

From [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0") to NetHack 3.4.3, including some variants based on those versions, [Sokoban Level 4b](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_4b "Sokoban Level 4b") is the only final Sokoban map that contains an amulet of reflection, effectively making it a 50/50 chance of obtaining one on the final level - some of the aforementioned variants retain this or else pay a form of homage to it. Starting in NetHack 3.6.0, both this and the [other final map](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_4a "Sokoban Level 4a") of Sokoban will generate either the amulet or an uncursed [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") as the prize.

## Messages

- But it reflects from your medallion!

  A ray was reflected by an amulet of reflection; this will auto-identify it.

- But it reflects from \<foo>'s amulet!

  A ray was reflected from an amulet of reflection worn by a monster.

- The floating eye's gaze is reflected by your medallion.

  You attacked a floating eye in melee, and its passive gaze was reflected; this will auto-identify the amulet and prevent you from being paralyzed.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), an amulet of reflection is the Sokoban prize for Level 4b and [Level 4d](/wiki/Sokoban_Level_4d "Sokoban Level 4d"). The Sokoban amulet is also made more valuable by the ability to [upgrade](/wiki/Upgrade "Upgrade") a [sack](/wiki/Sack "Sack") or [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") into a bag of holding.

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), the Sokoban prize amulet is always an amulet of reflection, with the other two choices being a cloak of magic resistance and a bag of holding. Non-[artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") items that provide [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or reflection can wear out from repeated resistance or reflection, making duplicate reflection sources a good idea to choose for the latter case.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban_\(UnNetHack\) "Sokoban (UnNetHack)") has a similar choice of prizes for each final level of the branch as NetHack brass: a prize amulet, a prize cloak, and a prize tool - the prize amulet has a 1⁄3 chance of being an amulet of reflection.

Obtaining [chromatic dragon scale mail](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scale_mail_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)") can free up an amulet slot used by this item for replacement with another, e.g. an [amulet of flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [minor spires](/wiki/Map_inclusion_\(dNethack\)#Minor_spire "Map inclusion (dNethack)") that appear within [the Outlands](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Outlands "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands") of the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Neutral Quest (dNetHack)") can generate with an amulet of reflection among one of the following sets of items:

- A [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") [khakkara](/index.php?title=Khakkara\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Khakkara (page does not exist)")
- A [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril") [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail"), a silver wand, and a mithril [buckler](/wiki/Buckler "Buckler"); this can only occur if [Soulmirror](/wiki/Soulmirror "Soulmirror") has already been generated

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban_\(NetHack_Fourk\) "Sokoban (NetHack Fourk)") has an amulet of reflection as the prize for the floors [Upon Further Reflection](/index.php?title=Upon_Further_Reflection\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Upon Further Reflection (page does not exist)"), [Collecting Marbles](/wiki/Collecting_Marbles "Collecting Marbles"), and [Back At Ya](/wiki/Back_At_Ya "Back At Ya") if you do not already possess one.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), you can create a shield of reflection at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining an amulet of reflection and a [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the Sokoban zoo closets have a prize behind each door, with one possible prize type being an amulet - the amulet has a 1⁄2 chance of being an amulet of reflection. Like other sources of reflection in EvilHack, the amulet also no longer fully protects you from the effects of rays while reflecting them, but still significantly reduces their impact.

4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 326](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L326)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/minion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 537](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/minion.c#L537)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2180](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/muse.c#L2180)

One risky potential means of testing for an amulet of reflection is using a [[floating eye]], where you are positioned in a manner that no other monsters can get to you if you are paralyzed - if you attack the eye in melee and its passive gaze is reflected by the amulet, it will auto-identify.

Beware of monsters possibly wearing the amulet, especially around the Sokoban [[zoo]] - this is ideally prevented by the scroll of scare monster placed underneath it, but it is still possible for a monster to end up on the square in a few circumstances. A closet with the scroll but no prize means one of the monsters has grabbed the amulet, and you should ideally avoid reflectable wands and spells if possible until you track it down.

==History==
The amulet of reflection first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

From [[NetHack 3.1.0]] to [[NetHack 3.4.3]], including some variants based on those versions, [[ki-rin]] are capable of wearing amulets. This makes the ki-rin an incredibly popular [[steed]] in those versions and variants, with the amulet of reflection being a common choice for them. This is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.0]] via {{commit|1a428307f324dd47af7cd3d11e4f086e8646bbe6}}.

From [[NetHack 3.3.0]] to NetHack 3.4.3, including some variants based on those versions, [[Sokoban Level 4b]] is the only final Sokoban map that contains an amulet of reflection, effectively making it a 50/50 chance of obtaining one on the final level - some of the aforementioned variants retain this or else pay a form of homage to it. Starting in NetHack 3.6.0, both this and the [[Sokoban Level 4a|other final map]] of Sokoban will generate either the amulet or an uncursed [[bag of holding]] as the prize.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], an amulet of reflection is the Sokoban prize for Level 4b and [[Sokoban Level 4d|Level 4d]]. The Sokoban amulet is also made more valuable by the ability to [[upgrade]] a [[sack]] or [[oilskin sack]] into a bag of holding.

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], the Sokoban prize amulet is always an amulet of reflection, with the other two choices being a cloak of magic resistance and a bag of holding. Non-[[artifact]] items that provide [[magic resistance]] or reflection can wear out from repeated resistance or reflection, making duplicate reflection sources a good idea to choose for the latter case.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], [[Sokoban (UnNetHack)|Sokoban]] has a similar choice of prizes for each final level of the branch as NetHack brass: a prize amulet, a prize cloak, and a prize tool - the prize amulet has a {{frac|3}} chance of being an amulet of reflection.

Obtaining [[Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon scale mail]] can free up an amulet slot used by this item for replacement with another, e.g. an [[amulet of flying]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[Map inclusion (dNethack)#Minor spire|minor spires]] that appear within [[User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Outlands|the Outlands]] of the [[Neutral Quest (dNetHack)|Neutral Quest]] can generate with an amulet of reflection among one of the following sets of items:

* A [[silver]] [[khakkara]]
* A [[mithril]] [[plate mail]], a silver wand, and a mithril [[buckler]]; this can only occur if [[Soulmirror]] has already been generated

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], [[Sokoban (NetHack Fourk)|Sokoban]] has an amulet of reflection as the prize for the floors [[Upon Further Reflection]], [[Collecting Marbles]], and [[Back At Ya]] if you do not already possess one.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], you can create a shield of reflection at a [[furnace]] by combining an amulet of reflection and a [[large shield]].

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], the Sokoban zoo closets have a prize behind each door, with one possible prize type being an amulet - the amulet has a {{frac|2}} chance of being an amulet of reflection. Like other sources of reflection in EvilHack, the amulet also no longer fully protects you from the effects of rays while reflecting them, but still significantly reduces their impact.
